metadata.title: CVE-2018-20976 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in fs/xfs/xfs_super.c in the Linux kernel before4.18. A use after free exists, related to xfs_fs_fill_super failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-165-generic - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-lowlatency - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-165-generic - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-165-lowlatency - 4.4.0-165.193
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-65-generic - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-65-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-65-lowlatency - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-65-generic - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-65-lowlatency - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1059-kvm - 4.4.0-1059.66
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1095-aws - 4.4.0-1095.106
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1051-aws - 4.15.0-1051.53~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1060-azure - 4.15.0-1060.65
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1046-gcp - 4.15.0-1046.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1026-oracle - 4.15.0-1026.29~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-165.193').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1059.66').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1095.106').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.53~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.65').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1046.49').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1026.29~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.132').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.135').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
